page.title: 11SLIMBRIDGE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: At the beginning of the Twentieth Century the educational needs of the area were catered for by a small school in nearby Cambridge. As the population of the area grew a new school was built a kilometre away on the outskirts of Slimbridge. At present there are fifty-four pupils at the school which is a co-educational primary school covering the five to eleven age range. The region is still fairly sparsely populated so the catchment area extends for some eight or nine kilometres and includes the settlements at Berkeley and Sharpness as well as the original villages of Slimbridge and Cambridge. Most of the pupils go on to one of the large comprehensive schools when they reach the age of eleven.
